prop.description:
# 1 ETH Test: Stacking Treasury Yield With Origin Ether

![OETH Graphic](https://imageupload.io/ib/7wHXLUdXjhsKHYD_1695230412.png)

**TL;DR**: 

I am Peter from the Origin Protocol core team. This is a proposal for a (very) low-risk test to earn yield for the Nouns treasury by utilizing Origin Ether ([OETH](https://oeth.com/)). Converting 1 ETH into 1 OETH (they are 1:1) for 30 days would act as a case study to test that Nouns can safely earn high risk-adjusted yields for the treasury by utilizing OETH. 

Origin Protocol is an OG team that launched in 2017. We launched OETH about 4 months ago, with the goal of making it possible for retail users to earn the same kind of yields that institutional traders earn, without needing millions of dollars and a full-fledged trading team. OETH deploys collateral to blue-chip protocols, distributing the yield back to holders daily via positive rebase. Current OETH yield is 8.01% APY on ETH, or about 2x that of the largest LSTs. 

We have seen much larger test case props to Nouns ([Prop 320 for example](https://nouns.wtf/vote/320)); in our opinion this is much too large of an amount to test a new technology with, which is why we are proposing to begin with a 1 OETH test, and can submit an additional proposal in the future for an increased amount as the Nouns community becomes more familiar with OETH. 

This proposal will include two transactions: the first to convert 1 ETH into 1 OETH, and the second to opt the Nouns wallet in for yield generation.

A more detailed overview on the proposal and on how OETH works can be found below. 

![OETH Graphic](https://imageupload.io/ib/3Uu8NmrrBr6axiU_1695230390.png)

## Stacking Treasury Yield With OETH

Previous Relevant Proposals:
18 - [Stake 1 eth in Lido](https://nouns.wtf/vote/18)
22 - [Stake 10% of treasury in Lido](https://nouns.wtf/vote/22)
30 - [Stake additional 10% of treasury in Lido](https://nouns.wtf/vote/30)
52 - [Increase Treasury stETH Position to ~20%](https://nouns.wtf/vote/52)
217 - [Stake additional 5000 ETH in Lido](https://nouns.wtf/vote/217)
227 - [Stake additional 5000 ETH in Lido](https://nouns.wtf/vote/227)
313 - [stETH peg protection](https://nouns.wtf/vote/313)
320 - [Treasury Diversification](https://nouns.wtf/vote/320)

**Summary**: 

This is a proposal to convert 1 ETH into 1 Origin Ether ([OETH](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/origin-ether)) to test OETH yield generation for the Nouns treasury.

**Abstract**:

This is a low-risk test to increase the yield of the Nouns treasury ETH/stETH from 0-4% to 8-10% utilizing Origin Ether (OETH). Converting 1 ETH into 1 OETH for 30 days would form a similar hypothesis as proposal 18 - in this case, that Nouns can safely stack yields utilizing OETH. 

**Motivation**:

From proposals 18, 22, 30, 52, 217, and 227, it is clear that the Nouns DAO was interested in earning yield on the treasury and extending the project runway. Proposal 313 signals that the community would prefer to continue earning yield with stETH, instead of eliminating risk completely and converting entirely back to ETH. Proposal 320 signals that other mainnet LSTs can be useful for treasury diversification. 

The OETH TVL has been trending upwards at a rate of about $1m per day since launch and has been crushing it in comparison to direct competitors with the yield we are generating. OETH yield is currently at 8.01% APY, whereas icETH APY is down to 2.94% and Cian stETH strategy is down to 4.02% despite taking leverage.

We are proposing to begin with 1 OETH, and can submit an additional proposal in the future to increase the amount as the community becomes more familiar with OETH. OETH provides significantly increased yields while also protecting against centralization and slashing events. 


## OETH Overview

Origin Ether was launched in May 2023 and is an ERC20 LST aggregator that generates blue chip yield while sitting in your wallet. OETH is backed 1:1 by stETH, rETH, frxETH, ETH, and WETH at all times; holders can go in and out of OETH as they please. Similar to stETH, OETH yield is paid out daily and automatically (sometimes multiple times per day) through a positive rebase in the form of additional OETH, proportional to the amount of OETH held.

OETH yield, currently ~8.00% APY, comes from a combination of:

1. Deploying ETH/WETH on Curve, Convex, and Morpho
2. LST validator rewards
3. A 50bip exit fee is charged to those who choose to exit OETH via the [dapp](https://app.oeth.com/) (completely avoidable if using a DEX), this fee goes back to OETH holders
4. OETH sitting in non-upgradable smart contracts does not rebase, instead the interest generated from those tokens is provided to those that can rebase

These 4 yield generating functions combined enable OETH to generate higher yields than holding or farming any single LST manually. The current collateral allocation and yield strategies can be seen on-chain at all times via the [OETH analytics page](https://www.oeth.com/analytics). Future OETH collateral and yield strategies are governed by [OGV stakers](https://governance.ousd.com/stake).

Obtaining OETH is seamless, anyone can convert from ETH, stETH, rETH, or frxETH into OETH via any of the following methods:

- Minting on [OETH.com](https://app.oeth.com/)
- Swapping on [Curve](https://curve.fi/#/ethereum/pools/factory-v2-298/deposit)
- Swapping on [Uniswap](https://app.uniswap.org/#/swap?inputCurrency=0x856c4efb76c1d1ae02e20ceb03a2a6a08b0b8dc3&outputCurrency=ETH)
- Swapping on [Maverick](https://app.mav.xyz/pool?chain=1&tokenA=0x856c4efb76c1d1ae02e20ceb03a2a6a08b0b8dc3&tokenB=0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2&fee=0.0004&width=0.001) 
- Swapping on [Sushiswap](https://app.sushi.com/swap?inputCurrency=ETH&outputCurrency=0x856c4Efb76C1D1AE02e20CEB03A2A6a08b0b8dC3&chainId=1)

For this proposal, Nouns will be using [The Zapper](https://docs.oeth.com/core-concepts/the-zapper) to convert the 1 ETH into 1 OETH. A second transaction will also be included to ensure the Nouns wallet is [opted-in for yield generation](https://docs.oeth.com/core-concepts/elastic-supply/rebasing-and-smart-contracts). 

**Benefits of Using OETH**

There are a few reasons for why Nouns would choose to use OETH over of attempting to use the same yield strategies: 

- The yield will always be higher with OETH than if you were to use any of the same yield strategies, since not all OETH is opted-in for yield, and because of the exit fee. At the moment 23,731 OETH is collecting yield and 21,280 is not, so Nouns would receive this boost in yield from the OETH opted-out. With the exit fee Nouns would get paid each time there's an exit - occasionally this puts the combined yield into the 100s!

- The Curve/Convex strategy would be very difficult (if not impossible) to replicate without having a Curve pool with a gauge + millions in TVL - Nouns would essentially need its own token and voting power and would be competing for yield with the other large flywheel token holders. 

- If Nouns were to do the same strategies, someone would need to manage the position. The OETH protocol would be that manager, with collateral reallocated among the whitelisted yield strategies each week. 

- The OETH protocol chases not just the highest yields but also the safest. During the weekend of March 10 when USDC and DAI depegged, it took the OUSD strategists/Origin engineers about 4 minutes to notice the depeg, and 16 minutes to start the process of moving the funds to a safer strategy. $0 were lost! 

- The OETH protocol covers all gas costs for moving funds between yield strategies, which is happening weekly but eventually will happen daily. With the price of gas on Ethereum, this could get costly for Nouns if Nouns were to follow the same reallocation schedule. 

- The cost for security - Origin has OpenZeppelin on retainer! Every new OETH contract is audited before going live. OETH security is prioritized over new feature development. The same level of security would cost Nouns millions of dollars in audit and development costs. 

- Top-notch development team - OETH shares 95% of the same code as OUSD, which has been live on mainnet for more than 3 years - longer than the Nouns DAO! The battle-tested code that has seen almost $400m combined has been and continues to be developed by a team of 10 full-time engineers. This level of talent required to maintain the smart contracts would be extremely expensive for Nouns, if Nouns were to try and replicate the OETH strategies. 


## Usage of Funds Generated

Since launch, OETH has earned a yield of about 2x that of stETH yield. With the extra yield generated for the Nouns treasury, there are several avenues for using the additional funds:

- Subsidizing public goods spend - Nouns traditionally spends ~800 ETH per month on public goods
- Subsidizing Nouns marketing - this would offset the cost for future Nouns movies, paid promotions, conference expenses, swag, and Noggles 
- Subsidizing Nouns infrastructure and auction expenses 
- Subsidizing cost for collaboration with other projects - Pudgy Penguins is just the beginning! 
- Funding large team efforts for less - it would take 50% of the stETH yield to fund another Nounish or Agora sized team effort
- Extended DAO runway - Nouns would extend the project runway twice as long


**Community Cases for Increased Yield**

I also don't think getting to our eth position to 100% staked eth limits our spending in any way… the ~500 ETH additional yield we'll get from staking the 10k ETH is not nothing. It's being able to fund another ~$1M / year sized team. That's like being able to fund another nounish or agora sized team effort, which is meaningful! - *Noun40*

I think the DAO should maintain around ~6mo of operating spend as ETH… diversify into other staking providers to reduce concentration risk. Overall in agreement with staking more ETH to increase runway. - *cfeng.eth*

The income generated from holding stETH also amounts to ~500 ETH / yr, which is more than 2 weeks of auctions. - *noun12.eth*

stETH is a better way of holding eth - *fugazi.eth*

I believe there is already too much of the treasury being staked in Lido. I am not interested in staking more, and if I were, I would want to use some other protocol that isn't Lido since we already have a lot in Lido. - *onnnnnnnion.eth*



## Potential Risks and Mitigation

There are six possible risks when using OETH, and Origin is making sure to reduce each risk as much as possible:

*New token risk* - Given OETH is a relatively new token, some may be worried that OETH is prone to new attack surfaces. While this may be true for other new tokens, OETH was built reusing 95% of the OUSD code, of which 10+ audits have been done since 2020. Not that long ago, [OUSD reached a market cap of $300m](https://defillama.com/protocol/origin-dollar) without breaking, and without diminishing the APY it was capable of generating. Origin continues to work on OUSD, despite the lower market cap.

*Counterparty risk* - OETH is governed by OGV stakeholders around the world. Everything from yield generation to fee collection and distribution is managed by a set of smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain. These contracts are upgradeable with a timelock and are controlled by hundreds of governance token holders. While the initial contracts and yield-earning strategies were developed by the Origin team, anyone can shape the future of OETH by creating or voting on proposals, submitting new strategies, or contributing code improvements. We intend for all important decisions to be made through community governance and limited powers to be delegated to trusted contributors who are more actively involved in the day-to-day management of the protocol.

*Smart contract risk of the yield strategies* - Origin is only using platforms for yield generation that have a proven track record, have been audited, have billions in TVL, maintain a bug bounty program, and provide over-collateralized loans. Over-collateralization in itself, combined with liquidations, provides a reasonable level of security for lenders.

*Collateral risk* - Origin has chosen 3 of the largest LSTs to ever exist to back OETH, and they have maintained their peg quite well since launch. They have also demonstrated significant growth in circulating supply, so the Origin team is confident that the 3 LSTs will maintain their peg and that OETH will remain stable to ETH. To ensure accurate pricing at all times, OETH is using Chainlink oracles for pricing data for rETH and stETH, and a dual oracle for frxETH that combines two sources: the Curve frxETH/ETH EMA oracle and the Uniswap frxETH/FRAX TWAP oracle. In situations where any OETH collateral falls below peg, [OIP-4 disables minting](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/issues/1000) of additional OETH tokens using the de-pegged asset.

*Slashing risk* - Since OETH is collateralized by multiple LSTs at the same time, OETH is protected from slashing from any individual collateral LST. If there is a small slash, the OETH yield will simply decrease, as income will likely exceed the size of the slash. During a major slashing event, both the slashed LST and OETH will experience a drop in value relative to ETH, but OETH should not fall as low and for as long as the slashed LST, as the remaining un-slashed OETH LSTs will soften the blow. There will never be a negative OETH rebase.

*Smart contract risk of OETH* - Origin is taking every step possible to be proactive and lessen the chance of losing funds. Security reviews are prioritized over new feature development, with regular audits being done, and multiple engineers are required to review each code change with a detailed checklist. There are timelocks before protocol upgrades are launched, and deep dives into the exploits of other protocols are constantly being done to make sure the same exploits don’t exist on Origin contracts. Security is extremely important to the Origin team. OETH was built reusing 95% of the OUSD code, of which 10+ audits have been done since 2020. All audits can be seen on [Audits - OETH](https://docs.oeth.com/security-and-risks/audits) , and OpenZeppelin is now on retainer. On-chain insurance protocol InsurAce awarded OETH and OUSD the [highest possible security rating of AAA](https://app.insurace.io/coverage/buycovers), of which only 3 other projects on the InsurAce platform have received. Optional OETH cover is currently available for both OETH and OUSD on InsurAce. Origin Defi also maintains a $1m bug bounty through [Immunefi](https://immunefi.com/explore/), with a resolution time of 7 hours. 


External OETH analysis:

[Llama Risk](https://cryptorisks.substack.com/p/asset-risk-assessment-origin-ether) - Asset Risk Assessment: Origin Ether (OETH)
[Auxo](https://mirror.xyz/auxo.eth/1NXxHhJmj44EfHmvA5pEH7mpSLtg-CbYRqmuEkaTRRk) - OETH - Protocol Analysis


OETH in the news:

[Coindesk](https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2023/05/16/origin-protocol-enters-competitive-ether-yield-market-with-oeth-offering/) - Origin Protocol Enters Competitive Ether Yield Market With OETH Offering 
[TokenInsight](https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/origin-protocol-launches-yield-aggregating-eth-derivative-called-oeth) - Origin Protocol Launches Yield Aggregating $ETH Derivative Called $OETH 
[Blockster](https://blockster.com/maximize-eth-staking-yields-with-oeth-a-yield-bearing-ether-pegged-token-by-origin-protocol) - Maximize ETH Staking Yields with OETH: A Yield-Bearing, Ether-Pegged Token by Origin Protocol 

**Closing Thoughts**

Peter is a core member of [Origin Protocol](https://originprotocol.com/) and is joined by the fully doxxed Origin team and community, which includes hundreds of thousands of members and open-source contributors. Many members of the Origin team, including both founders, are holding a significant portion of their personal wealth in OETH. Origin Protocol’s corporate treasury is also holding millions of dollars in OETH. We have skin in the game and are willing to put our own money at risk with the code we have written.

There are no lockups with this proposal, Nouns can move in and out of OETH as the Nouncil, core team, DAO, and community desires. OETH remains completely liquid at all times, and can be spent in the same way as its backing collateral, if unexpected expenses were to arise.

- OETH (≠) Celsius, Blockfi, FTX, or any other failed platform over the past few years. It is purely Defi

- Audits, audits, audits 

- 10+ audits have been done on the OETH codebase, and more are being done right now with OpenZeppelin on retainer. View the audits here- https://bit.ly/OETHaudits

- The OETH codebase is 95% of the OUSD codebase, which has been live since January 2020 with no issues

- No energy is required from Nouns to hold OETH, or manage an OETH position - OETH is designed to be passive 

- It would require only half as much ETH as stETH to earn the same amount of yield. Imagine if 5,417 ETH were returned to the treasury to be spent on Nounish things

Appreciate the teams time on this proposal but I have repeatedly voted agains the DAO pursuing defi yield (including any sort of eth staking). I see it as a distraction and the more we do it the more time and energy we'll have to put into these types of proposals. 

*sent from voter.wtf*
thank you for submitting. i agree with others that the treasury should not take on risk outside of staking at this time
supportive of very low cost experimentation, unsure atm abt stacking yield on large treasury amounts
We do not need to yield farm. We need to fund builders, world building and proliferation efforts.
Was on the fence bc 1ETH is a small ask for an experiment, but if we are experimenting, would like for us to prioritize tooling and creator economy incentives.

I am opposed to treasury management proposals for the same reasons as the past. Let’s keep things simple and focus on public goods.

*sent from voter.wtf*

I just wanted to express some onchain support for the proposer, Peter from Origin. Even if the prop may not be for Nouns right now, I think he's done a great job navigating the proposal lifecycle from idea -> candidate -> onchain and even came back to vote with reason. It's been a pleasure getting to know Peter and talking all things nouns with him the past few weeks.

# Creative Commons retry

at a glance it appears circulating Nouns supported this tx.

# Investing in the Growth of Nouns DAO in Japan🇯🇵

![](https://eibakatsu.com/ndj/ndj_banner.png)
# TL;DR
[Nouns DAO Japan (NDJ)](https://discord.gg/a5467Y2bGs) is the largest Nouns community in Japan. [NDJ's Prop House](https://prop.house/nouns-japan)  has been a cornerstone of our growth and community engagement. However, we have noticed a decline in activity since our last round, Round-10. Consequently, this issue has been concerned many of us who see the immense potential in our local community.

One Major hurdle is the language barrier. Many Prop House events are in English, limiting the participation of our largely Japanese-speaking community.

To address this gap, we would like to kindly request your financial support to re-launch and sustain our Prop House for a period of one year. We believe this will boost Nouns DAO's brand awareness in Japan and create valuable content. We'll also look for self-funding options during this period. 

**Total ask: 18 ETH**.
- Rewards: 0.5 ETH * 5 props * 6 times = 15ETH
- Operations & Public Relations: 1 ETH/year * 3 persons = 3 ETH

# What is Nouns DAO Japan
Pokemon, Hello Kitty, Anpanman, Super Mario, Dragon Ball, One Piece, Naruto, etc... Japan is home to iconic characters and boasts a rich culture of derivative works and cosply. This cibrant creative scene serves as fertile ground for talented creators. 

Nouns DAO Japan (NDJ) is the largest Nouns community in Japan with approximately 3,300 members. Various creators, mainly Japanese, participate in NDJ and enjoy creating secondary Nouns works while engaging in friendly competition.


The following is a corner of the creativity from NDJ.
## Nouns New Parts Creation
 ![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H14J-ArJT.png)
 The beluga created by [amiyoko](https://twitter.com/amiyoko_eth) on the left was adopted for [Anniversary Art 2023](https://nouns.wtf/vote/348).

## Nouns Base
![](https://i.seadn.io/gcs/files/c878d0a2d11b92ce308d9b403855ce35.gif)
Nouns secondary production created by [KURAN](https://twitter.com/KURAN_Nouns). A secret base to build with friends.

## And more
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SJHbi0Sk6.png)
Many creators gather at NDJ to create fascinating works of art!


# Why should Nouns DAO invest in the Prop House of Japan
Japanese creators have uniquely blended local culture with NounsDAO's vision, generating captivating content. However, activity has slowed since Prop House Funding ceased after Round-10.

Various communities are holding Prop House, but unfortunately, only a limited number of Japanese are able to participate in other Prop House because of their poor English skills.

It is a great loss for Nouns DAO that during this time, talented creators from the character powerhouse of Japan are leaving Nouns DAO.

# Prop House Recipients of Support
Here are some of the achievements supported by NDJ's Prop House.
## Nouns National Baton Relay ([Round-1](https://prop.house/nouns-japan/round-1/653))
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJssgkIyT.png)
The baton relay is actually handed over in the real world as “Noggles = Baton".　This initiative will increase loyalty to the Nouns DAO by directly connecting people who love Nouns with each other in Japan.

## pNouns ([Round-5](https://prop.house/nouns-japan/round-5/2027))
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H1O-5WwJT.png)

[pNouns](https://pnouns.wtf/en/) is an experimental project that has the potential to fundamentally change the social structure with ”real NFT” and ”real DAO”. We are going to become a member of Nouns DAO, recognized ”real DAO” and propose a project to the pooled 35 million treasury.

## Ethereum Navi ([Round-5,6,7](https://prop.house/nouns-japan/round-5/1949))
[Ethereumnavi](https://ethereumnavi.com/tag/nouns/) specializes in cutting-edge Crypto native NFT projects, Web3 development information such as Solidity, and other information around Ethereum.
The platform features accessible articles on Nouns, significantly contributing to the project's expansion in Japan.

## UNouns ([Round-6](https://prop.house/nouns-japan/round-6/2540))
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Bk83oQD16.png)

[UNouns](https://unouns.wtf/) = Nouns doing United Nations. UNouns attempts to create community and governance that will access global issues, SDGs and create better world by utilizing treasury, that can be used by the community. By expanding the ecosystem, UNouns DAO aims to create better world with DAO and hornorable presence for Nouns.

## And more
![](https://eibakatsu.com/ndj/support.png)
In addition to the above mentioned creations, support for IRL activities and technologies was also provided.



# Advantages
**ROI:** By hosting Prop House, we will increase the engagement of talented Japanese creatives with Nouns, and this will increase the brand value of Nouns.

**Sustainability:** We will hold Prop House on a regular basis for 12 months to see sustainable results. After that, we will consider our own ongoing measures.

**Expand community:** Attract new participants to NDJ and increase credibility and awareness of Nouns DAO in Japan.

# Operations
### Hosting Of Prop House
lead: [Eiba](https://twitter.com/eiba8884)
- Prop house will be held every 2 months.
- Set up a reward of 0.5 ETH*5 from the funds donated.
- Giveaway [NDJ PFP](https://opensea.io/collection/nouns-dao-japan-pfp) to the person who gets the most votes each time.
- Voting right will be [POAP](https://opensea.io/collection/nounsdaojapanpoap) issued by Nouns DAO Japan once every six months.
### Public Relations
leads: [Takumi](https://twitter.com/Okirakukai) & [Daynao](https://twitter.com/daynao_daynao)
- Regular space will be held daily. This space has been running for more than a year and is growing Nouns DAO Japan's core fan base.

# The Future
Nouns DAO Japan is considering next steps after receiving one year of assistance.

The first candidate is **JPNouns**.
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/B1-EwILya.png)

Nouns holding auction & treasury system from "Japan" was adopted in [Round-9](https://prop.house/nouns-japan/round-9/5482). It is still in the planning stage, but it is a measure to spread the Nouns in Japan, separate from Prop house.

The evolution of Nouns DAO in just a year has been remarkable, and we anticipate even more transformative changes ahead. Rest assured, Nouns DAO Japan is committed to exploring the best path forward.

Thank you for your continued support.

votes.reason: The way i look at this prop is that we give Nouns JP some added autonomy. I trust them to find good use for the funds.
Believe in the power of Japan!

i worked w the nouns dao japan community in the early days and have nothing but good things to say about my experience with them. i applaud them for taking the next step and requesting funds directly from the dao to become more independent in their decision making. 

please keep us updated via updates.wtf!
This Japanese DAO is contributing expansion of Nouns in Japan and 0.5ETH for one activity seems reasonable.

Japan is great

Japan cooks. Japan knows Japan. 🦾🎌

We like NounsDAO Japan which has a strong track record of doing cool stuff, and the grassroots Prop House-driven funding model here, which feels like the most aligned form of IRL proliferation for Nouns.

Poll failed to meet vote threshold.

**FOR - 15 VOTES**

**benbodhi** | *"Let them cook"*

**peterpandam** | *"prop house is a great tool"*

**AGAINST - 18 VOTES**

**ABSTAINS - 8 VOTES**

Japan has already witnessed the emergence of two outstanding organizations, pNouns and NOUNS BASE .

However, there's a concerning sign when browsing "Nouns Japan House":
The NFTs of Nouns Japan House are highly centralized. This leads to an undesirable trend: a lack of transparency, where stakeholders rather than creators tend to come out on top.
In rounds 1-7, this phenomenon wasn't that pronounced, and occasionally, one could spot some talented creators.
However, in rounds 8-10, the past three winners were all from the same organization, accumulating the votes and securing the funds.

Two characteristics are observed in Nouns Japan House:
1. Some commendable creators have already left the community; their Twitter accounts haven't mentioned 'nounsdao' in the past six months.
2. The circle is tightening, with grants mostly going to those inside.

This is merely a well-intentioned reminder. For this prop, we abstain from voting.

**eusoujp.eth** | *"Japan is doing a great job!"*

**ABSTAINS - 10 VOTES**
this group is bursting with energy and experimentation. happy to support

Super for this! 

As a side note, I agree that Nouns can be particularly impactful in Japan due to its stellar, recognizable character design and vibrant brand colors, especially if we create relatable character stories (or even generative short bios like those in the Sanrio world as a start 🥹). 

Excited to see where this leads.
Pnouns and NounsDAO Japan have been incredible in their proliferation. Excited to see what they do!

prop.description:
# Sensuality in Art: Proposal for Funding a Transformative Project

The tone of the project will be one of inclusivity, respect, and open-mindedness. Our objective is to establish a new branch within the DAO, a more mature and secure space where artists can freely express their interpretations of nounish in art space. Simultaneously, we encourage the DAO to approach this topic with an open heart and mind. By promoting dialogue and understanding, we aim to challenge preconceived notions and nurture a more mature, accepting, and diverse community.



**Note:** The project's creators have chosen to maintain their anonymity, prioritizing a focus on the project's message and artistic vision rather than individual recognition. 



# First Shot : Sensuality

**Introduction:** In the world of art, sensuality has always played a vital role in evoking emotions, pushing societal boundaries, and expanding creative horizons. This proposal aims to investigate the profound connection between sensuality and art, while seeking funding for a project that celebrates and explores sensuality in various forms. By delving into this captivating topic, we aspire to craft a thought-provoking experience that visually engages and inspires the community. 
Keywords: Sensuality, art, community.

**Body:**

The proposed project aims to create seven immersive art pieces, each representing different expressions of sensuality applied to characteristic nouns, corresponding to the seven days of the week. By collaborating with four esteemed photography artists, our goal is to craft a visual experience that celebrates sensuality and its richness.

These pieces will be thoughtfully curated to explore various facets of sensuality, including its ties to human emotions and the natural world. Through meticulously designed works of art, we aim to prompt viewers to contemplate their own perceptions of sensuality and challenge societal norms surrounding this often-misunderstood concept.

To ensure the success of this project, we are seeking funding to cover several aspects, including artist fees, additional incentives, production, and the care of these pieces. By securing the necessary funds, we can provide artists and staff with the resources they require to create impactful and thought-provoking artworks.

Furthermore, this project aspires to extend beyond its initial phase. Future plans include organizing more immersive and expressive materials, enabling viewers to engage visually and musically.



**Rise of Sensuality:**

Sensuality, often considered taboo in many cultures, holds delicate curves and unique identity within the body. Art, in its purest form, serves as a means of self-expression for the body, a visual language.

Allow me to introduce one of the guest artists - [Guido](https://x.com/guidodisalle), a renowned name in photography, known for his aesthetic sensibilities and indescribable visual prowess.

![](https://imgur.com/k4RMWal.jpeg)

[Guido Di Salle's](https://www.flowcode.com/page/guido)

**Minting and Distribution**

Out of the seven pieces produced, only two will be made available for minting as limited editions, created by our invited artists. Details will be provided on each guest artist's profile when unveiling their piece.

**Cost:** 7E to cover team expenses, provide additional incentives, and compensate the artists + 4 NounsVision to be sent to invited artists.

**Conclusion:** In conclusion, this project seeks to explore the captivating intersection of sensuality and art through an immersive experience that can enrich our cultural understanding and initiate a new community. With secured funding, we can embark on a journey with talented artists to create a transformative experience, challenging societal norms and celebrating diverse expressions of nounish in the world of art.

votes.reason: Not really sure where I stand on this proposal, however I think showing the diversity of nouns brand to go beyond cute characters to sexuality is an interesting experiment. Let's see what happens.
Modestly costing pilot towards a differentiated subDAO

Personally anxious about how overwhelmingly male the dao is, and what it means for the sort of long-term cultural impact we will be likely to make as long as our voter base contains such an obvious bias in shared experience. 

Not sure the extent to which this prop amplifies the issue (we only have the photos/artist provided to go off of wrt to claims of "inclusivity" etc). However, since it seems to clearly tread on the subject of gender-normativity, I think I will generally defer to the voice of the dao minority, especially if they have been vocal on a specific prop, as is the case here.  

So, +1 werder, at least until further examples or addtl background are offered that indicate a richer diversity of perspectives.
would have been more engaged with a pure video prop, perhaps even retro funded

(noun40 voting via agora)

feels off to me. personally I think nouns x nudity is a weird combo in a similar way to nouns x violence is a weird combo. of course nouns is cc0 and anyone can do anything with it but I don't feel the need to fund / subsidize the activity.

also in general, anon is fine but new to the dao anon prop I feel weird about. who dis? is a fair thing to ask if you're asking $10k from the dao.
Does not seem like a good cultural fit for the DAO. Agree with 40. I don’t see the connection.

I am generally a fan of the idea. this version, something seems off. I side with Prof on her thoughts here, however am NOT against the genre or the artists involved. 

Hearing more and help understanding would be nice. I enjoy the discussions it brings up!

I don't love that we literally have no idea who is behind the prop. Pseudonymity is cool because you can get a sense of reputation/past track record, but first-time prop anonymity especially post-fork feels more ripe for opportunists and I'd want to err on the side of caution. The artist is the one person we do know and have had their fair share of controversy around model compensation and other things, so not super confident here.

*sent from voter.wtf*
+1 onion

i'm generally here for us diversifying the way nouns shows up, but this subject is a VERY delicate one and it feels like if we're going to do it, it should be done in a very thoughtful way and by reputable, trusted folks. don't think this prop meets that bar.

Against this for a few reasons but mostly i'm unsure if it's nounish; It's unclear who is proposing, what artists they'll onboard aside from Guido, and if the artist(s) or proposer really understands nouns/if that will come through in this body of work.

*sent from voter.wtf*

**FOR - 5 VOTES**

**borg00000** | *"i like photos and nfts , ask is small enough to give this a go imo"*

**AGAINST - 34 VOTES**

**akva556** | *"???"*

**adrianmcli** | *"As much as I want to support independent artists, previous experience has shown that this is not the best use of money for our DAO."*

**peterpandam** | *"too abstract. need definitive deliverables"*

**0xDariush** | *"i prefer to see the artist get involved with us directly."*

**robotfishgirl** | *"As someone whose first forays into visual art were along similar veins, I'd actually be a fan of this sort of prop with the right team- but given that this is an anon submission, and given one of the names mentioned in the prop, it's a hard no for a multitude of reasons."*

**ABSTAINS - 5 VOTES**
love art but not nounish.
the proposal lacks specific details and clarity on goals, deliverables, how, etc. (+ doesn't feel that nounish to me)

https://www.lilnouns.wtf/vote/nounsdao/392/votes

**FOR - 487 VOTES**

**AGAINST - 231 VOTES**

**ABSTAINS - 13 VOTES**

**sqx10.eth** | *"Unsure on the process and goal ."*
Nouns is a family brand to me. Would love to see this prop over at ENERGY, although we need to raise more funds in our Treasury first.

This proposal has many parts that don't seem to fit and requires the reader to do the work. Establishing a different branch of the DAO, through photographs, that will be part of a droposal, but only a few? I don't quite understand where it's all going. The right proposal could persuade the DAO to expand the Nouns brand into this domain, but it needs to be coherent and compelling.

Voting against for the simple reason that the art vibes and subject matter proposed diverges too much from where the Nouns brand currently stands. Agree that sensuality / sexuality / nudity doesn’t fit in Nouns culture yet, IMO this would be more a disruption than an extension / proliferation.

doesn’t fit my mental model of what it means to be nounish (i mean that respectfully)

best of luck to the proposers ❤️

There could be a version of this prop that might make sense, but in its current form, I'm strongly against. For my full reason, please see: 
https://paragraph.xyz/@nounishprof/butwedonthavetofundit

I like a lot of this, but something feels off. I'd love to see more professional photography and nouns being a part of that. This prop in particular lacks clarity in the longer term plan in regards who else will be involved, but I'd like to see the seven pieces. Maybe there's a possibility for retro funding something along these lines so everyone can see the results.
Agree with others on uncertainty re: people behind the project and the end result. On top of that, doesn't feel very aligned with nouns overall branding.
while anyone can do anything w nouns on their own, would want higher conviction in the execution/output/vision if the DAO were funding this type of initiative

I really appreciate the idea of Nouns pushing into different art styles. I also have talked with the team and believe that they have strong backgrounds to approach this type of work thoughtfully.

My main concern is with the sequencing. The beauty of CC0 is that you can execute first and receive approval later. Instead of funding upfront as an official branch within the DAO - a designation that I’m uncomfortable with for any proposal - launching a derivative and then seeking retro funding for approval seems like the way to go.

Would love to see the team go ahead and execute this as a derivative, regardless of the proposal outcome. That would help build support in the Nouns community and not require an “official” designation upfront before anyone sees the approach.

*sent from voter.wtf*

prop.description:
# Gift Noun 542 to Bob Burnquist

![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafybeicmfhrpam75ycjyf7rjmvcern5f7ba4wn2xwlagryuyqq2jy2dreq)

**Requesting Noun 542 and 15000 USDC** to assist with the tax burden of being gifted a noun, to a [hardware wallet address](https://etherscan.io/address/0x3dfd76a87cf769275e5Bc8c4AB77e47D50eCDA49) retrieved from and owned by Bob Burnquist, the legendary Brazilian-American skateboarding hall of famer, and repeat Nouns DAO contributor.

## 🛹 Meet Bob

![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafybeidvgfdn65nvwugmodzlqumyvskclhpkjv5pdosdpe3rbwjqixz2oy)

[Bob Burnquist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Burnquist), a name that resonates with innovation, audacity, and unparalleled skill in the world of skateboarding. Born in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Bob has not only transformed the skateboarding landscape but has also left an indelible mark on global culture. Gifting Noun 542, adorned with a skateboard head, to this skateboarding maestro would be a fitting tribute to his legacy.

## 💥 Cultural Impact

![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafybeifoecnwfhetsm3zpkw5342ai6v4lckbo2xmo7nkww45idczou6mfy)

▶️ *[Click here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=wlL4NPOrYck) to watch the above video*

Bob's influence transcends skateboarding. He's been a cultural icon, inspiring countless individuals to challenge the status quo and redefine boundaries. His Brazilian roots combined with his global appeal have made him a bridge between cultures, fostering understanding and appreciation for the sport across continents.

## 🧲 Media Magnet

![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafybeidet2efui2mxkiduurct3x2m2nc4ggemgvvsdhsmogoyczkfqkwki)

From video games like the iconic "Tony Hawk's Pro Skater" series to documentaries and live broadcasts, Bob's presence in media is vast. His Dreamland series, which showcased his private skatepark, was a testament to his creativity and became a viral sensation. His stunts, especially the heart-stopping Grand Canyon jump, have been broadcasted worldwide, further cementing his status as a skateboarding superstar.


## 💸 Charitable Endeavours

![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafybeia4t4k2zg6g3ptxxdfisowu7reisskj4rr5jm6jmq2njj7xbqpmwi)

Bob's heart is as big as his talent. Through his institutes and foundations, he has consistently worked towards the betterment of society. From promoting skateboarding among underprivileged kids to championing environmental causes, his philanthropic efforts are commendable.

## 🫂 Nounish Contributions

Bob's engagement with the NFT world and Nouns DAO is not just as an icon but as an active contributor. As a partner at **NFT Brasil**, he's at the forefront of integrating the vibrant city of São Paulo into the NFT landscape, with a robust collaboration planned in the coming year. 

![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafkreigxcco4jkqhbtj6kphjirdxgmno3cdwv7u5tohu2yc2ftseipdz6a)

His social program, **Skate Cuida**, is a testament to his commitment to community upliftment. Through this initiative, he's been onboarding individuals into the world of technology, offering programming classes, and witnessing transformative progress. The launch of [SkateboardingCares.com](http://SkateboardingCares.com), a collective that's making "concrete waves," is powered by [That's Gnarly](https://thatsgnar.ly) and further amplifies his dedication to merging skateboarding with technological advancements.

[![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafybeidmc4oopw35og6e37gtv7fpppurjnfm3zcrjfurymgwf76rnyknl4)](https://twitter.com/bobburnquist/status/1604636743332159488)

Bob's advocacy for the NFT space is evident in his active participation at various events. His recent presence at **Blockchain Rio** and the upcoming engagement at **Rio Innovation Week** from October 3-6 showcases his dedication to promoting the onchain world. With **Skateboarding Cares DAO** being a pivotal component, he's ensuring that the skateboarding community is intricately linked with the latest in blockchain tech.

![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafybeice6gg7is34tfvkx4iwbifdjcvg64fimxbjwgdfted44rpbikf274)

For those keen on tracking real-time updates on these endeavours, Bob's [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bobburnquist/) and [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bobburnquist) both serve as a window into his contributions and the broader impact of these initiatives. Or to get some further context on Bob's involvement with Nouns DAO, check out [Proposal 142](https://nouns.wtf/vote/142) that was sponsored by Gnars DAO.

## 🔥 Bring on the "Burnquest"

Gifting [Noun 542](https://nouns.wtf/noun/542) to Bob Burnquist would be more than just a token of appreciation. It would be a celebration of a legend, an acknowledgment of his contributions, and a testament to the indomitable spirit of skateboarding. We'd be embarking on a quest of serendipity together, where the potential for collaboration is boundless.

![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafkreicn34ghkmznkjyfn7zhbnyni73hwfmldaqhthpqivpi7frksopu2e)

Bob's committed to repping Noun 542 and participating in governance, as both a voter and nounish builder. His creativity and groundbreaking track record are testament to what he could, and already does, bring to Nouns. If there are times where his full focus is needed elsewhere, there's ample opportunity for thoughtful representation through delegation, either by his team, vast network with deep industry experience, or as part of educational endeavours at his institute. 

![](https://ipfs.decentralized-content.com/ipfs/bafybeideeb4fbkn2i3s37fmq5tnkzr3krmi5l4wyza7sx7a2tcchkwddge)

▶️ *[Click here](https://www.voxels.com/play?coords=E@1007E,1112N) to visit to Bob's Voxels property (got a tour on our most recent call)* 

I've followed Bob's career since I was a child, and as an amateur skateboarder, I'm thrilled to have even met him, let alone be collaborating with him directly. Gnars has taken me on such an incredible journey and Nouns has made it all possible. It's a wonderful feeling to come full circle and present an opportunity such as this one to the community I hold so dear. Can't wait for everyone to see what Bob's been cooking.

🔥 *Here's to Season 3 and the future of Nouns!*

*[Gami](https://gami.wtf)*

prop.description:
# 🔥 The Burn: audit funding

We are planning to propose an upgrade that implements [The Burn](https://w.mirror.xyz/AmHOzH-FQZVO3IhGXHSvCRxRSf2MO6VCZdmMwNEIyKE). The goals for the burn are described in the blog post above by wilson.

This is a first draft of the proposal candidate through which we will ask the DAO to fund one or two audits of the implementation. We are putting it up even before we have quotes from auditors, in order to raise awareness among voters, stimulate the conversation, and listen to feedback.

## Technical spec

We plan to deploy a new contract, with a single function that lets burn excess ETH from the timelock.

### How much will be burned?

Excess ETH is defined as the difference between the treasury value denominated in ETH, and: adjusted_total_supply * trailing_N_day_mean_auction_price.

adjusted_total_supply is the number of minted nouns, excluding nouns held by the treasury or in the escrow contract.

In order to calculate the treasury value in ETH, the contract will consider only ETH, stETH, rETH & WETH. All other assets are ignored.

The number of auctions looked at when calculating the mean price is a configurable parameter; we suggest starting with 90.

Example based on numbers close to actuals:

Treasury has 2857 ETH, 10830 stETH, 228 rETH.
Adjusted total supply: 394.
Mean price of last 90 auctions: 30 ETH.
Treasury value in ETH: 2857 + 10830 + 247 (228 worth of rETH) = 13,934 ETH.
Excess ETH: 13,934 - 30 * 394 = 2114 ETH.

### What is burned?

Only ETH is burned. If the Nouns runs out of ETH, it will need to swap other assets (e.g. stETH) into ETH to allow for more burn.

### When can it be called?

The goal is for the burn to happen at predictable times. One parameter will define what will be the first noun id at which the first burn can happen. Another parameter will define how many noun ids need to be minted before the next burn can happen.

Example:

Suppose the first noun id is set to 1000, and the number of nouns between burns is set to 100. The first burn will be possible once a noun with id 1000 is minted. The next burn would be possible once a noun with id 1100 is minted.

Even if the first burn actually occurs when noun 1002 is auctioned, the next burn will still be possible starting id 1100.


### Timelock upgrade

The timelock will be upgraded to a new version which will allow the burner contract to call it an burn ETH.

The timelock will only allow the burner contract to call it.

The address of the burner contract is a configurable param. Setting it to the zero address is effectively turning off the burn mechanism.


## Audit costs

Our plan is to undergo a deep code review with solimander, and an audit with [Sherlock](https://www.sherlock.xyz/). In a bit more detail:

1. Soli review (+ verbs fix things)
2. Sherlock audit
3. Verbs fix things + soli reviews fixes
4. Sherlock mitigation review

We are asking for 30K USDC to be sent to the Tech Grants Pod multisig to pay for the audit.

## Next steps

Funding the audit will let us know the DAO wants the burn to be deployed. Once funded we will finalize the code, undergo the audit, and follow up with a proposal to upgrade the auction house contract and the treasury contract.

The upgrade will leave the burn disabled, since it seems best to separate the deployment of the mechanism from reaching consensus on its parameters. We will of course support any voters who will want to follow up with a proposal to set the burn parameters.

It's also worthwhile for voters to consider converting stETH into ETH ahead of the burn, since as mentioned above this simple design only burns native ETH.

## Appendix: pseudocode

ExcessETHBurner:

```

// configurable params:

uint numPastAuctions;

uint nextBurnNounId;

uint mintsBetweenBurns;

function burnExcessETH() {

    if (auction().nounId < nextBurnNounId) revert('Not yet');

    

    allowedTreasuryInETH = adjustTotalSupply() * meanAuctionPrice();

    excessETH = treasuryValueInETH() - allowedTreasuryInETH;

    amountToBurn = min(excessETH, timelock.balance);

    

    nextBurnNounId += mintsBetweenBurns;

    

    timelock.burnETH(amountToBurn);

}

function treasuryValueInETH() {

    return timelock.balance + stETH.balanceOf(timelock) + 

        wETH.balanceOf(timelock) + rETH.getEthValue(rETH.balanceOf(timelock));

}

function meanAuctionPrice() {

    return mean(auctionHouse.prices(numPastAuctions));

}

```


## Appendix: current asset breakdown

At the time of writing this text, [according to Etherscan](https://etherscan.io/tokenholdings?a=0xb1a32FC9F9D8b2cf86C068Cae13108809547ef71):



* Total treasury value is roughly $23.15M.
* Its two main assets are:
    * ETH at $4.391M (2631.493 ETH).
    * stETH at $18.061M (10830.768 stETH).
* These two assets alone make up over 96.7% of the total treasury value.
* USDC is roughly 1.1% of the treasury, and we’re comfortable ignoring it for the sake of code simplicity.
* wstETH is roughly 0.11% and is ignored as well.

(noun40 voting via agora)

the concerns around not having good props to spend on ahead of the burn are likely a bit over blown imo. we already have a stoopid buddy (nouns stories) prop asking for $1.8M. maybe that doesn't pass. but the rise of blus atrium movie could easily ask for another $1M? nounish is likely going to come for an 6 mo extension with a $0.5-1M prop too? esports will also likely come back for 2024 funding with a \~$1M prop? these are just our existing best executing teams that could easily ask for $2-3M. that's already more than the 2114 ETH excess eth burn amount calculated here. of course true market price of nouns might be 20 ETH instead of 30 when we have real price discovery. but then also we're experiencing fork #1 which will reduce the treasury size further. I just think "we won't have things to spend on!" and thus imagining some terrible forced spend is likely not to be true.

also the example given here as the first burn happening on noun id 1000 means the first burn would be around feb 1, 2024. that's around 5 months from now (ofc we could choose an earlier or later date when we are at the stage of deciding parameters but the point is that voting in the burn mechanism doesn't mean the first burn will occur immediately at that point).

so if normal spending already has a good chance of being enough spend for bv price to drop close to auction price in a 5 month timeframe then what is the whole point of adding this mechanism? it's the effect the existence of the mechanism will have for the long term in settling a long standing debate we've been having within nouns.

in the history of nouns governance there's been two fundamentally different views on how nouns nfts should attempt to be more valuable. the bv camp believes that that is done by growing bv (treasury size should grow FASTER than the nouns supply so that the pro rata share of treasury per noun goes up). a big part of this viewpoint has an underlying assumption that meme value (intangible value) accrual is likely not going to be a thing so the tangible thing (bv) should be the thing we focus on and grow. the other camp (let's say meme value camp) wants to really run the meme value growing experiment by actually spending and not being overly concerned about preserving bv in the short term. the endless debate about this fundamentally different viewpoint has resulted in nouns not being able to really commit to a given direction and so much brain cycles spent in the repetition of the same fundamental governance disagreements. the burn mechanism encodes that this dao is about running the meme value accrual experiment. my view is that we should make this encoding while we actually have the alignment on this topic. being able to resolve a long standing governance disagreement in an elegant way like this is a gift.

I flip-flopped on this a bit, but took the time to understand what this means, thought through spending scenarios, and reframed this in my mind as 'forced spend.' I don't think ETH will be burned or wasted— it's time to accelerate the project and proliferate the meme!

Sadly, this is causing some serious issues in Lil Nouns and across the ecosystem. I think the framing/optics behind this have been pretty bad for those looking from the outside in.

Voting for, largely based on the DAO-wide discussions and calls we had. Initially, I was against the idea of introducing a new mechanic at the protocol level (burn or otherwise), since I strongly believe the more simple and un-opinionated the protocol the better. The more mechanics we enshrine, the more unforeseeable the secondary and tertiary consequences.

In this case, however, I was swayed by the idea of experimenting with a burn mechanic to see how that adjusts DAO/proposer behavior. I am in favor of trying out a burn (even gamifying like the Mr Beast example) and assessing if it ended up being a meaningful driver to our overall goals. 

*sent from voter.wtf*

I respectfully disagree with Noun40.

The majority of creations touted as having significant "meme value" largely resonate only within our existing Nouns community. Rather than proliferating the Nouns meme to a broader audience they often preach to the choir.

A forced spend is a dangerous gamble that will only AMPLIFY this inward focus and drive DOWN the quality of proposals. It will encourage a surge of low-quality pitches, knowing there's an impetus to disburse funds.

We're playing with fire here, we risk sacrificing quality for quantity (spend volume).  We ought to aim for impactful, external-facing initiatives rather than merely echoing our own voices.

Appreciate the thoughtful discussion here so far and look forward to more in the coming weeks. 

One way or another, the DAO is currently setup to "burn" money. Currently this burn is to arbitragers. I'm not sure if anyone has run the total on what was arbed out in the last for but I'd guess > $2M. 

Something has to change. 

There are several proposals. The alternatives I am aware of--things like capped exit, timelocking funds--have significant downsides. 

Timelocking hurts honest actors: imagine honest forkers trying to leave have their funds cut by a DAO voting to lock the funds away. 

Capped exit arbitrarily disadvantages certain nouners owners solely based on the price their noun was sold for at auction. It would warp the secondary market: nouns bought at a higher auction price are worth more. And why? Why does a secondary buyer of a Noun auctioned for a high price deserve more in a fork? Why is an honest actor who bought at a low price and wants to fork capped in how much they can take away? 

Moreover the energy of these proposals is hyper focused on eliminating the arbitrage, which I fund uncharismatic. No one want to join a DAO that is primarily focused on not getting arbed. 

With the burn, I think we have a chance to fix the arb, while actually being primarily focused on more exciting things. I would support the burn even if the arb was not an issue. Already I see the burn forcing healthy conversation on things that were already issues, like, "What if it just amounts to a new round of funding to past proposers?" If the DAO is captured by past proposers, I'd like to know sooner than later!  And the burn is creating efforts to break out to new proposer audiences. 

The assumption of the opposition is that having more time leads to better outcomes. Sometimes! Generally not in young organizations. Things tend to happen quickly or not at all. Slow often = dead. Nouns is not a hedge fund with a salaried staff. There is more at play. We need attention from the voters to do well. We need attention from proposers. Slow often means less attention. People stop caring. "Nothing is happening over there." 

What's the downside of the burn? It's pretty capped in my opinion. The DAO can vote to remove it. The DAO can mitigate via rapidly distributing the treasury Nouns. There are lots of options. 

But I think in the best case we get to test a theory: that Nouns spending more aggressively will lead to better outcomes. And not *just* trying haphazardly to spend more aggressively, but doing so in a legible context: voters and proposers alike know the DAO is highly incentivized to spend X by a certain date. This is super helpful for organizing in a decentralized context. 

That's my thinking, eager to hear yours. Let's find the best path, together 🫡 

*sent from voter.wtf*
Expanding our tool kit to be able to do this is worth it, even if we never turn it on.

I would not go down this path.

In investing and in all things really, you create value by having more options rather than less.  More choices, more time, etc many dimensions.  The burn reduces the DAO's options timewise and reduces the treasury both. It's not innovation, it isn't reinventing investing or resource allocation or corporate governance, it's not even a good experiment, it's an ex ante mistake, a self-inflicted wound.

I appreciate the hard work from Verbs and Wilson on the Burn, and recognize that many in the DAO already excited about this version of the future. With respect, I disagree with this approach. I don't think that as it stands today, our community is ready for this level of forced acceleration in spending, and don't think in general that it is wise to be forced to spend.

As someone who firmly believes in the meme value of Nouns, and is willing to invest heavily into it, I see this proposal as strictly increasing the overall risk of the project. If we think we are currently on track to spend the excess value by the burn date, then why have this mechanism at all?

If we want Nouns to last years to come, there will inevitably be dry spells, and we don't want to be forced into allocating into things that we wouldn't otherwise have just to avoid burning. If we're dissatisfied with the progress of some of our biggest spends, we want to be able to credibly say "hey, you need to change this or we might not be excited to fund you again". The burn removes that ability.

While it's true that more positive spend generates more attention from voters and proposers, I don't think it's the "healthy" way to do that. If we want to attract quality artists and builders, then we need to do the hard work of making Nouns more attractive to proposers by solving the friction points they experience today.

If attracting proposers is the goal, I'd rather see us invest in things like: extending candidate functionality, function tipping for clients, streaming payments tied to propdates, nouns retro-rewards, droposals, creating an incentive for proposal sponsors, etc.

As a builder, I should be excited about the burn because technically the DAO is now "forced" to spend more, but I'm not, because it doesn't solve any of the underlying mechanical issues that make contributing to Nouns DAO difficult. Throwing more money at the problem will make it seem like things are better, when in fact might actually make it harder to figure out where the builder pain points are.

Although the Burn might be exciting in the short term (and to be honest, I personally can't help but be excited to see how the experiment plays out), I worry that it unnecessarily jeopardizes the long term survivability of Nouns. Yes, we can technically "unship" it, but the reality is that once in, it'll be very hard to gather the social consensus to take it out, just like the fork. Even if we discover that the cons outweighs the pros, I expect that we'll have to live with it and try to fix it forward.

I want to be working on Nouns with everyone here for 10 years to come, and view the Burn as introducing more risk than benefit on that time horizon.

HOW TO BURN 
// 
this Vw/R is focused on addressing the perpetual pressure of treasury drain via fork under v3 without altering the exit economics, diluting via Nouns redistribution or siloing funds. The simplest tool that remains is burn. The conclusion is that the spec does not adequately discourage toxic buying interest and mitigate long-term financially-motivated forking pressure. 

To address, burn must continue, every day, proportional to the real volatility of the Nouns meme and the degree of 'moneyness' of the exit price. 
//

The reason v3 creates endless downward pressure on the treasury is because it issues a perpetual put option to a holder (or coordinated holders) with access to a % of Nouns >= the forking threshold struck at book value.  

A put option is simply the right to sell an asset at a pre-arranged price (the 'strike' price, in this case, current pro-rata bv), and are widely used by hedgers as insurance on asset value loss. Nouns is first to market with meme insurance! I will use the option language going forward since I think it provides the greatest clarity, and will leave pricing math/models out (provide in other forums if of interest).

To the best of my knowledge there is no way to expressly eliminate this option as an asset bundled to a Noun without further constraining the fork mechanic. So, this means the problem to solve is how to properly price the put option so that the dao is compensated for assuming leveraged downside risk, or, at the very least, so that the token buyer is levied an appropriate fee to disincentivize free riders/option-value investors. 

Options carry asymmetric upside (call options have unlimited return potential, and puts have potential to yield 100% of the strike price). In exchange for this upside, the option buyer must pay something to the seller. The seller, in this case, is Nouns DAO. What is an everlasting put option on Nouns worth? How much are we charging?   

Positive value of the put consists of 2 primary components: 

1. Intrinsic value- This refers to the value the option has if 'exercised' immediately. If the value of a Noun at auction/secondary is 20 and the exit value is 30, the intrinsic value is 10. Paying anything less than 10 for the option gives you, more or less, the infamous 'rfv.'  The burn is solely focused on trying to reduce, or, in the minds of some advocates, eliminate this piece completely from new auction buying interest by driving the exit price at or below the sale price. 

2. Extrinsic value- This refers to the insurance value the option has even if it is not 'in-the-money.' Having the perpetual right to sell a Noun at 30 has value, even if the auction price is 35, 50, 100, etc. Naturally, that value is reduced the higher the current market premium to the exit price becomes. The spec'd burn does not systemically address this value. However, as the % of the value of a Noun it is generally the more significant term, particularly when exit value is near parity with (or even resolutely below) auction prices. One of the main reasons for this is that the options term is perpetual. 

Pricing perpetual options: 

Vanilla options expire, which means the cost is proportional to the risk term. If you buy a put, or insurance (generally), it is not good forever. You pay a cost for a certain period of coverage. V3 insurance is different. We can't assign a fixed cost since the option is always good. The way this sort of asset is ordinarily priced is via a funding rate debiting at regular intervals until the option 'buyer' is out of capital to maintain the position. Its a subscription plan.

Nouns is, again, different. The tool to tax the option owner is not directly with new fees, but by progressively reducing the value of the option via burn. This assesses a fee to all option holders by intervallically reducing exit price. A burn can make the cost-of-carry of Noun ownership much more predictable and closely matched with its inherent value. The further the premium of market value to bv becomes, less burn is required. 

Extrinsic value is figured according to the 'implied volatility' of the underlying asset. Volatility measures how much an asset changes in value over a period of time (independent of direction), and you can arrive at a statistically 'fair' value for an option if you have a good estimate of the underlying asset's volatility. At time of writing, for a year of $28k price insurance for BTC, for example, you must pay 20% of the current value (around $5.6k). Note the intrinsic value of this option is (at time of writing) $0. Also note crypto is in the midst of a historically low-volatility regime. In more active markets the amount could be 40% or even higher. These values correspond to a (current) low of 52% up to 100% implied annualized volatility.   

In Nouns, a reasonable estimated range for the annual real value of an 'at-the-money' put (ie when exit value = auction value) would generally be worth between 35-95% of the market value of the asset. This uses a range of 100-250% implied volatility, & annualized burn rate would need to be in the range of 35-95% as long as auction price is near bv.

The values mentioned above frame the issue conservatively. Notice that implied volatility (extrinsic value) can not be well modeled using historical auction prices as long as there is intrinsic value arbitrage; meme value volatility is locally swallowed by the 1st order rfv. Instead, we can use pre-v3 auction prices (which, too are imperfect, due to the presence of bv-minded investors from the beginning), or the volatility of correlated assets (pfps, etc). As is hopefully intuitive to most, the volatility of memes is...not low.  

If we want to charge less, or nothing, we can, but it opens the dao to severe stochastic arbitrage, and we likely invite in a voter base comprised primarily of volatility scalpers, the treasury operating as a bi-directional slush fund for the trade. 

As drop in bv outpaces drop in 'meme value' (here generally meant as the fungible value of a Noun independent of exit value), the burn may slow, but never fully stop, since a perpetual 'out of the money' put holds nontrivial value. For example, an exit value at 15 with current meme value at 30, using an implied volatility of 150%, implies an annualized burn of 20%. 

Burn must continue, every day, proportional to the real volatility of the Nouns meme and the degree of 'moneyness' of the exit price. Thus, the treasury tends logarithmically towards 0, and the value of the put becomes progressively more marginal (though never 0). In this way, exit ultimately is self-invalidating under v3. More aligned buyers will trickle in, with exit & the treasury correspondingly neutered.  

Nouns = (almost) pure meme.
 
Problem (almost) solved. 

Still, the  fat-tail utility of the exit remains as long as there is eth in the treasury, and as meme value contracts, the puts become relevant selling pressure once again, forcing the dao to accelerate spending to adjust for its increased exposure. As long as the treasury has non-zero value, the puts stay on the book. 

It may seem like a subtle point &  one nobody is likely to stress much about. Sort of agree. What it means, though, is that forking pressure still lies in wait during market capitulation, adding addtl downside leverage to the meme itself (if forks are progressively delegitimizing, as i believe they are).  

A separate conversation, but there is a case to be made that we would want to set ourselves up to be strong when the market is not, not thrown again into chaos with centralizing reversion as our only remedy.

Under v3, the treasury is a liability. burn it all

saving up the treasury in excess of the nft market cap leads to people bidding on the treasury instead of aligned membership. aligned membership is our most important resource because it is the primary driver of dao security, dao attention, and moving the project forward. given that aligned membership is currently blocked by the treasury (with no natural resolution in sight), i support upgrading the protocol to address the problem. thank you to wilson and verbs for the elegant solution

prop.description:
# Aburra (fka Alphacaster): Nouns x Farcaster

TL;DR: Requesting 24 ETH for Aburra (formerly Alphacaster) to explore the frontier of Nouns x Farcaster and build a best-in-class web3 social app for the next 3 months. Payment via steaming.


### Overview

Farcaster represents a unique opportunity to decentralize Nouns communication and bring Nounishness to more onchain organizations.

At Aburra, we have been building at the intersection of Nouns and Farcaster since early 2023 and have won Nouns Hack Week for our MVP v1 in April.

Today, Aburra has evolved significantly since its v1. In addition to being both a Nouns client and a Farcaster client, it allows anyone to host Farcaster spaces where listeners can directly vote for proposals.

![Aburra iOS](https://i.imgur.com/Fm3kQS3.png)


Our ambition is not just to create the best Nouns client, but to make all DAOs more Nounish by helping them communicate on top of an open and permissionless protocol (i.e. Farcaster).

We also hope to use this prop to see what is possible when you combine two of the best web3 ecosystems - we want to push towards a future where open communication protocol is favored over Discord and Twitter.



### What Aburra has delivered so far

**Applications developed**
- [Alphacaster.xyz](https://Alphacaster.xyz) and WebView-based mobile apps ([iOS](https://testflight.apple.com/join/JLPtu4r8) and [Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=xyz.alphacaster.app) - to be combined with the new app): DAO-specific Farcaster feed, governance notifications, enhanced proposal pages with cast-based comments etc.
- A proposal bot ([@alphabot](https://warpcast.com/alphabot)) to convert all props, votes, auctions and propdates into casts
- Beta Aburra app ([iOS](https://testflight.apple.com/join/uLiAhdUA) and web): Been testing it for two weeks and it now supports Farcaster space with native DAO integrations (proposal and voting)

![Nounish Emoji Reactions in Aburra](https://i.imgur.com/RQCt0fz.jpg)

**Current traction**
- Aburra has become the default way for Farcaster users to consume proposals and votes. In the last 30 days, it had 3.9K unique visitors. It also has Warpcast [integrations](https://warpcast.com/dwr.eth/0x3cec05).
![](https://i.imgur.com/oT7WtK7.png)

- Since we started testing the new app in early Sep, we've hosted 9 Farcaster spaces for Nouns, Purple and Nouns Builder. 80 users have installed the [app](https://testflight.apple.com/join/uLiAhdUA). More Nounish spaces are in [the](https://warpcast.com/aburra) [pipeline](https://warpcast.com/toadyhawk.eth/0x64bd48).
![](https://i.imgur.com/rXUDxAX.png)

### Plan for the next 3 months
- Full integration with Farcaster channels, including reading Nouns channel directly in
the app (and in any space)
- Phase out the old Alphacaster app and merge all functionality into Aburra: this
includes implementing everything (governance feed, proposal pages etc.) natively,
instead of using WebView, which will significantly improve UX
- Better space UX, with native DAO features (NFT minting, droposal, smoother voting etc.)
- Integrate with more Nounish DAOs (and others!)
- Launch Android

### Team

Aburra has 2 full-time team members, billzh.eth ([@billzh](https://warpcast.com/billzh) on FC) and blingbling.eth ([@16](https://warpcast.com/16) on FC). Both of us are experienced developers and have built production-grade consumer applications.

So far we have received 12.9 ETH grants from Nouns Builder ([9 ETH](https://www.alphacaster.xyz/dao/BuilderDAO/prop/48)), Nouns Hack Week ([3 ETH](https://prop.house/nouns/hack-week-developers-developers-developers/5256)) and Warpcast ([~0.9 ETH](https://warpcast.com/v/0xd74872)).


### Ask

The ask is 24 ETH (0.2% of current treasury) to help us continue to build Aburra for the next 3 months. That is, 8 ETH per month for a team of two.

The team is lean and we are confident to deliver a top-tier application with significantly lower cost than comparable clients (House of Nouns at [95](https://nouns.wtf/vote/242) ETH, Agora at [220](https://nouns.wtf/vote/154) ETH and Prop Lot at [60](https://nouns.wtf/vote/244) ETH).

prop.description:
# Update the Descriptor to Reduce Auction Settlement Gas

## Summary

This proposal resolves a storage creep issue in the Nouns' Descriptor contract, which has caused the gas required to settle an auction to increase with each added batch of traits.

A [new descriptor contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0x25ff2fde7df1a433e09749c952f7e09ad3c27951) has been deployed with a simple optimization that reduces auction settlement by 40,000 gas, and prevents future increases as traits are added.

The art in the new descriptor contract is identical to the descriptor that's currently used in production.

## Technical Details

For those who are technical, you can find the full changes [here](https://github.com/nounsDAO/nouns-monorepo/pull/804/files).

Simulations of Reduction in Gas:

- Before: [87,367 gas](https://www.tdly.co/shared/simulation/567299e9-05cc-4f10-ac66-6b71dceb3fcd)
- After: [48,121 gas](https://www.tdly.co/shared/simulation/99ac1499-fb4f-4d8a-99e4-6c115e336f2d)

---
